perturbation.explanation: The definition of "Agreement" is changed to "any agreement entered into by both parties, not exclusive to this agreement" to conflict with the Preamble. The Preamble explicitly defines "Agreement" as *This* Manufacturing Agreement. This internal contradiction creates uncertainty about which agreements the term refers to. Additionally, the location where the definition of AMAG can be found has been changed.

perturbation.original_text:
3.1 Supply of Product.

(a) Commencing on the Effective Date and continuing during the Term, Antares shall manufacture and supply, or have manufactured and supplied by its Subcontractor, all quantities of the Products, sample Products and Trainers ordered by AMAG in the Territory pursuant to this Agreement. Commencing on the Effective Date and during the Term, AMAG shall commit to purchase its entire requirements of Product(s), sample Products and Trainers for sale in the Territory from Antares.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.1 Supply of Product.

(a) Commencing on the Effective Date and continuing during the Term, Antares may choose to manufacture and supply, or have manufactured and supplied by its Subcontractor, all quantities of the Products, sample Products and Trainers ordered by AMAG in the Territory pursuant to this Agreement. Commencing on the Effective Date and during the Term, AMAG is not required to purchase its requirements of Product(s), sample Products and Trainers for sale in the Territory from Antares.
perturbation.explanation: Section 3.1(a) is modified so that Antares isn't obliged to supply all quantities of the products and AMAG is not required to purchase its requirements from Antares. This contradicts the original agreement that Antares *shall* supply and AMAG *shall* purchase their needs from Antares.

perturbation.original_text: 12.5 Governing Law; Choice of Forum. This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the substantive laws of the State of New York, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. The Parties agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods does not apply to this Agreement. Except as otherwise provided in ARTICLE 11, all claims and proceedings under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the state or federal courts of competent subject matter jurisdiction in New York City, State of New York. The Parties hereby waive (i) any objection which it may have at any time to the venue of the proceeding in any such court, (ii) any claim that such proceedings have been brought in an inconvenient forum, and (iii) the right to object, with respect to such proceedings, that such court does not have any jurisdiction over such Party.
perturbation.changed_text: 12.5 Governing Law; Choice of Forum. This Agreement shall be governed by and interpreted in accordance with the substantive laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. The Parties agree that the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods does apply to this Agreement. Except as otherwise provided in ARTICLE 11, all claims and proceedings under this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in the state or federal courts of competent subject matter jurisdiction in Dover, State of Delaware. The Parties hereby waive (i) any objection which it may have at any time to the venue of the proceeding in any such court, (ii) any claim that such proceedings have been brought in an inconvenient forum, and (iii) the right to object, with respect to such proceedings, that such court does not have any jurisdiction over such Party.
perturbation.explanation: The governing law is switched from New York to Delaware, and the forum from New York City to Dover. In addition, The United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods has now been applied, when it initially wasn't applied. This is an internal contradiction in terms of where any claims and proceedings should take place, creating uncertainty.
